thread.title: Broncos Surge in Second Half to Secure Home Opener Win
thread.title_full: Broncos Surge in Second Half to Secure Home Opener Win

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Broncos Surge in Second Half to Secure Home Opener Win
text:
Broncos Surge in Second Half to Secure Home Opener Win
The Cal Poly Pomona Broncos secured a 65-58 win against La Sierra during their home opener at Kellogg Arena. After a sluggish start, the Broncos surged in the second half, leveraging strong defense and timely scoring to improve their season record to 4-1. Malcolm Bell and Demarreya Lewis-Cooper played pivotal roles, while the team executed crucial plays to maintain their lead in the closing moments.
- Broncos outscored La Sierra 41-34 in the second half.
- Fast-break points heavily favored CPP at 26-6.
- Cal Poly Pomona scored 15 points off turnovers compared to La Sierra's 3.
Despite the win, the Broncos faced challenges with their perimeter shooting early on, which could impact their performance against stronger opponents as the season progresses.
State of Play- Broncos are currently 4-1, showing promising early-season form.
- The next game is scheduled against Biola in La Mirada, Calif.
Looking ahead, the Broncos aim to build on their momentum against Biola, where effective shooting and defense will be crucial to maintain their winning streak.
Bottom LineThe Broncos' ability to overcome early adversity and execute under pressure highlights their potential this season, but consistency in shooting will be key to sustaining their success.
Read more at Cal Poly Pomona Athletics
